website_summaries.verdict: This belt-style sharpener can handle blades other models can't, like scissors and tools.
pros: Quick sharpening, and belts are easy to change
Belt design makes it possible to sharpen scissors, tools and more
Guide sharpens kitchen knives to a 40 degree angle and outdoor knives to a 50 degree angle
Comes with three belts of different grits sharpen blades in stages
cons: A few users reported motor problems with their machines
Follow instructions carefully - a few have shaved the tips off their knives

website_summaries.verdict: This sharpener is highly versatile and sharpens almost any surface with an edge.
pros: This power tool requires very little manual effort
Ideal for the great outdoors, with high-grade materials designed for rugged use as well as at home
Features coarse, medium, and fine belts to fit all your sharpening needs
cons: Make sure you read the instructions fully, or you could make the knife duller than before

customer_reviews.text: Production description said the following is including: Work Sharp Knife & Tool Sharpener Power Platform, 9 pc. Abrasive Belt Kit (3) P80 Coarse (3) P220 Medium (3) 6000 Fine, (1) 20° Kitchen Knife Sharpening Guide, (1) 25° Outdoor Knife Guide (includes Serrated Knife Guide and Scissor Guide), (1) Retractable Honing Rod, (1) Nylon Carry Bag, User's Guide, Instructional DVD. Where is (1) Retractable Honing Rod, (1) Nylon Carry Bag, User's Guide, Instructional DVD.
customer_reviews.author: Satish Janardan

customer_reviews.title: You will ruin your knives with this...look at the customer pictures CLOSELY.
customer_reviews.text: For kitchen or chef knives, it's a train wreck. Rounds the tips. Basically impossible to prevent it. A point, on almost any knife, particularly kitchen and pocket knives, is integral to the blade. If the point gets rounded, you lose utility. THIS WILL ROUND THE POINT of the blade...100% of the time. Look at the customer photos closely. Even the 4 and 5 star rated reviews, almost every single knife has a rounded tip. Almost none have an intact point. If you're OK with removing a major aspect of the utility of your blade, have at it. You'll have very sharp knives for the main body of the blade...but you'll lose the point completely.
customer_reviews.author: boscbiji

customer_reviews.title: I received my Work Sharp knife sharpener this morning. ...
customer_reviews.text: I received my Work Sharp knife sharpener this morning. After opening the box and seeing I received everything that I was supposed too, I looked through the instructions. Lo and Behold I saw this, so, all y’all that complained about scratching your blades, it’s all on you! Lol I started to sharpen my scissors and I need a lot more to go, they’re old. I’m giving it 4 stars for now. New in box, all the accessories and it was packaged right.
customer_reviews.author: Jarhead

customer_reviews.title: Uneven bevel due to design, knives are nowhere near to sharpness advertised
customer_reviews.text: Sharpens knives unevenly due to design. On the side where it is going down takes off less and burries knife into plastic guard. Did it with no pressure at all stll takes knife into a guard. The other side where the belt is going up it takes off more. Did it by the book : red belt 10 times, purple belt 10 times alternating and neither one of my knives is razer sharp or even sharp to cut a piece of paper like they show it. Watched whole bunch of videos on YouTube trying to see if I was doing it wrong. Nope. Really disappointed, expected a lot better results. Afraid to even try it on my good knife.
customer_reviews.author: Alek

customer_reviews.title: Very good product but once again some missing parts in the box
customer_reviews.text: I never found any place to request only for the missing parts I only received 6 belts instead of 9, nor the Instructional DVD, the user's guide and the Nylon Carry Bag), and needed to order another one, my surprise once again is that I received the same parts. I simply do not understand why they offer Nylon Carry Bag, User's Guide and the DVD and is not included!. I will definitely return it!...
customer_reviews.author: Gil Ancer

customer_reviews.title: I wouldnt use on high dollar knife
customer_reviews.text: Dont make the sand paper level. itll eat your blade up. It ate mine up. its hard to eaxplain but when you twist the red knob, it need to be off set. NOT STRAIGHT
customer_reviews.author: Brody

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't sharpen Ceramic Knives
customer_reviews.text: It does work on Stainless Steel knives but I bought it specifically for Kitchen Ceramic Knife sharpening. Had to use up both the 180g / 1500g DIAMOND over approx. 30 min "sharpening" session with duller results. I have over twenty years of Professional Experience as a woodworker, wood sanding & hand sharpening scrapers, chisels with xlint results. Waste of time. More cost effective to just send in the knife and bring back to factory sharp. Ceramic will last 100 x's over Stainless Steel. Addendum: make sure to wear a dust mask or just use a fan. Last note: it may have been these expensive but cheap diamond sandpapers from->  Not seen a refund yet.
customer_reviews.author: Rob Tak

customer_reviews.title: Could not get any blades sharp on this version.
customer_reviews.text: I've read instructions, watched video tutorials, and tried working with it for hours on different blades. I couldn't get anyone of them sharp enough to cut printer paper or shaving sharp. The problem is that its not user friendly. The guides are way too small and the belt moves the blade as you are trying to hold it properly. The grip matters little contrary to what they said. I've been a line cook for 7-8 years and I am no novice when it comes to sharpening.
customer_reviews.author: jester77o7

customer_reviews.title: Deserves a 6 star rating!
customer_reviews.text: This is the best invention since sliced bread! I absolutely love it. After watching a couple of videos, and reading the quick start guide, I sharpened about a dozen knives in less than an hour. Each one, mostly poor quality ones, were sharpened enough to shave the hair off my forearm! I look kinda funny now so I'm wearing long sleeves. Anyway, the item works great. I really can't think of any cons. I was considering buying the ken onion edition that is more expensive, but this one seems to work just fine and I can't imagine what else I would want. Great product!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cannot control belt direction! Creates asymmetrical bevels.  Poor.
customer_reviews.text: It's a decent small belt sander, but really poor for knife sharpening. You cannot control the direction of the belt, so you have one bevel being pulled along toward the burr and one bevel cutting towards the spine. This generates an uneven bevel and an inconsistent burr on all steels I have tried so far. Also, due to the soft belt materials and the innate tendency of soft belts to convex grind with barely any pressure, it's nearly impossible to not round tips. It makes me sad, because it's a made in USA product with great build quality.
customer_reviews.author: John V.

customer_reviews.title: Belts won't stay on or hold up
customer_reviews.text: Right out of box sharpened a few knives with the 25 degree guide impressively. Tried to use without guides to do some free-hand polishing & axe sharpening, belts kept flying off. Adjusting tracking knob did not solve. Contacted Work-Sharp customer support, 8 days later still no response. Tried sharpener one last time after lining up the pulleys again & putting the guide back on, this time it shredded the belt. Returning for refund. 2 stars for those first few knives. Returning because belts won't stay on or get shredded & no customer support. And, yes, I read the owners manual cover to cover before using. Also, significant dust & smell.
customer_reviews.author: Manlee1

customer_reviews.title: Needs better instructions
customer_reviews.text: My brother has one and really likes it. I had trouble from the very beginning. It didn't come with the instructional D v d and that was part of the problem. After I figured out how to remove the angle guide and put on the medium grit belt l couldn't get it to work very well on my test knives. At one point the belt got caught on the drive spool and tore apart. I'm guessing that I was more of the problem but it would love helped having better instructions. I'm still going to try the fine grit belt on a small knife to try and get a really good edge on it.
customer_reviews.author: Luk2c

customer_reviews.title: Electrical smoking with first use
customer_reviews.text: After reading the instructions and watching the how-to videos on your site (and on Youtube), and not being happy with the Chef’sChoice 15 Trizor XV EdgeSelect Professional Electric Knife Sharpener, I was eager to sharpen the kitchen knives. After a few swipes with the first knife, a bit of black plastic flew onto the counter, and the unit began smoking, with an electrical smell. IT'S GOING BACK!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good for regular knives
customer_reviews.text: Knowing the difference between a sharp knife and a REALLY SHARP knife may not be significant to some. I like my EDC to be really sharp. This sharpener is good for knives that need a reasonably sharp edge. Fast and easy to use. I don't like the 50 degree guide for knives and scissors. For knives it needs the two-sided support like the 40 degree guide. I'm happy with the edge it did on my scissors. Overall it is a decent tool, but I would still use a more precision sharpener for your GOOD blades.
customer_reviews.author: Keith Elbe

customer_reviews.title: Not what is pictured at all!

This thing did not even fit together. Very disappointed as I set aside a whole afternoon to clean and sharpen my tools.
customer_reviews.author: MJTE

customer_reviews.title: Buy this now- you don’t even realize how much you need it!
customer_reviews.text: Wow this turned out to actually be far more impressive than I was expecting. It’s so simple to use and you can change out the little sandpaper belts in like 30 seconds. I sharpened about 14 different kitchen knives that we have and it took about 1 minute each. This sharpens so fast and maintains the angle for you making everything effortless. I’ve been looking around the house for things to sharpen because it’s kinda fun. I’ve even used it for things in the garage like chisels and scissors. 10/10 Great product and cool idea.
customer_reviews.author: Adolfs Ghost

customer_reviews.title: I expected more
customer_reviews.text: Based on all the reviews, I figured this would be a great product, but I've used it on several different knives and can't get a razor-sharp edge on any of them. It gets the blade sharp, but not any sharper than I can get with a much cheaper sharpener. I thought maybe it was just my technique, but I've used it a lot now and there's no improvement. Don't get me wrong, the blades are sharp, but just not what I was expecting.
customer_reviews.author: SaoirseMT

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the money
customer_reviews.text: At first I thought this was a pricey tool, but quickly learned it's one of the best sharpening systems available. The tool is well made and there are many videos and instructions to help you master it. It not only sharpens knives but everything from scissors to lawn mower blades. Using a small version of a three point belt grinder, this little unit makes quick work of any job. It makes kitchen knives dangerously sharp while giving mower blades a durable edge. Now I believe all the good reviews and knida shake my head at the bad ones. If you can't sharpen an edge with this machine, you better just stick with Ginsu knives.
customer_reviews.author: George J. Novak

customer_reviews.title: One half correct
customer_reviews.text: This is a reasonably nice knife sharpener although not so easy to use correctly. However, it is also labeled a "tool sharpener" and it is not acceptable for that. I had problems getting the correct edge even on small chisels and if it was to be used for large tools, the extremely narrow grinding belt would take all day and wear out $10 of belts in a hurry. It is recommended the manufacturer change the mis-leading title to eliminate the reference to "tool sharpener".
customer_reviews.author: JDTechnical

customer_reviews.title: Like a tabletop grinder and can sharpen super fast!
customer_reviews.text: So far, i've sharpened all the kitchen knives and my pocket knives, and all the scissors i can find and it has been absolutely amazing. I hadn't had it long, but i'm loving this thing sooooo much! This thing does exactly as it says it will. I don't plan on using it for garden tools like my shovels and what not, but so far everything i've put to the test on this thing it has far exceeded my expectations. If you want to sharpen knives and do it quickly, THIS is what you need!

I had the dullest knives ever and they are now absolutely as sharp as possible.

For the money they get for this tool, it should be foolproof.

Great producer of sharp knives otherwise..

customer_reviews.title: More than impressed!!

When I made the purchase I also didn't realize it was coming with all the extra belts and the additional guards to do knives scissored's and work tool. I am highly recommending this if you're looking for a fast simple way to get a razor-sharp edge. If this was helpful or you like my review, please click "Helpful" Many Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: Miix

Great selections of grind bands for various levels of sharpening.
customer_reviews.author: J. Halvorson

customer_reviews.title: Shave the hair off your arms sharp!!!
customer_reviews.text: If you are trying to decide if this works you can read no further, this is the real thing! I'm not a pro knife sharpener but I was shaving the hair off my arms with every knife in the house after using this thing. I sharpened every blade in the house in less than an hour. It comes with 2 sets of belts and I purchased an extra 2 set, I could start a small business with this thing. This is the easiest sharpening kit I have ever had. You can buy the second generation sharpener for double the money but this will be fine for most folks.
customer_reviews.author: dsouth1111

customer_reviews.title: Takes a LOT of practice
customer_reviews.text: After rounding off the tip of several knives, I finally got the technique to not do that anymore. But if you follow the instructions exactly, you're gonna round off the tip. Not easy to use, and the convex edge doesn't seem to say any sharper than a more traditional concave edge, regardless of what the instructions say. Exploring other sharpeners for easier use.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Pays for itself within days! Don't wait any longer, buy this today!
customer_reviews.text: Kicking myself for waiting so long to pull the trigger on this purchase. Watch some videos. Practice on old knives you're not too attached to, then go to town sharpening everything you should have been sharpening for the last ten years. But be CAREFUL!!! I've sliced myself a few times when working with my newly super sharp knives.
customer_reviews.author: Chris "Great day for hay"

customer_reviews.title: A must have for every day knife sharpening
customer_reviews.text: About as good an electric sharpener you can get. I would practice with cheap knife at first to get the hang of it, because it will remove a lot of material if you are not careful. You only need to pass a soft metal once or twice to get razor sharp. I used the spyderco sharpmaker for years, but got tired of the time spent using that for my every day knives. This is quick and easy. Keep in mind if you are sharpening several knives at once, it leaves a fine dust all around. So probably best to use in the garage or in an area you can clean up easily afterwards.
customer_reviews.author: Bobby B

customer_reviews.title: Works if you are right handled and nimble
customer_reviews.text: Precise blade alignment is critical to do a good job. This is insanely right handed only. It should be ambi - alas for the design. Have a magnifier and strong light nearby and sit down to use this. You must bring the blade to the machine, not the other way. OK with mild steel. For very hard blades this can work but beware heating. For general blades, not surgical / dissection items. Doing curved tips requires practice as there is no guide nor templates.
customer_reviews.author: CI

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t sharpen only polishes the edge.
customer_reviews.text: Not impressed with this product. I find it easier to use a file and sharpening stone for knives. When it comes to using it on mower blades and my hatchet all’s it seems to do is polish the edge. I bought to use on my kitchen knives but am rethinking that as it didn’t do a good job on my pocket knife. The on off switch has a locking on when you use speed two but not on lower setting. Makes it hard to do edges with one hand. I would not recommend this product as it’s over priced and doesn’t do what it claims.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Long

customer_reviews.title: THE ONLY TOOL I'VE FOUND THAT ACTUALLY WORKS - KNIVES ARE RAZOR SHARP!!!
customer_reviews.text: This tool works like a charm - follow the directions and the knives are sharper than new. My wife was complaining that her kitchen knives were really bad. I've used sharpening stones, sharpening guides with stones and other gadgets in the past with mixed results. This tool does exactly what you need with no hassles. I ordered extra packs of sharpening belts as the tool comes with a limited number. If the tool is replaced by a newer model in the future, it's a good idea to have extra belts as they may be discontinued also.
customer_reviews.author: hopewell guy

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product for those who use knives and want to keep a good edge.
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent product. I gave it to my father, who is a farmer, as a Christmas gift. He always complains about all his dull pocket and kitchen knives and he had spent a month trying, on and off, to sharpen a pocket knife with a handheld, roller style sharpener. It took him less than five minutes to put a paper shearing edge on that knife with this product. We were both overly impressed. He's been sharpening every blade he has in the house and shop since Christmas. There is a slight learning curve, so practice on a cheap or unimportant blade first.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Wade

customer_reviews.title: OMG it really works as advertised, yahoo
customer_reviews.text: I’ve used a number of different sharpeners in the past without a lot of success for kitchen knives. I watched YouTube videos for this sharpener and followed the instructions for proper use and WoW did it do the job for me. I also used it on my Becker BK7 and it slices like a hot knife through butter, pardon the cliche. I was able to sharpen (red belt) and hone (purple belt) 3 knives in under 5 minutes using for the first time. FYI I also use a large plastic ammo box from “Harbor Freight” that includes a removable tray to hold my new sander and additional belts with a lot of room to spare.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Wallace Ferguson

customer_reviews.title: So glad I finally spent the money and got a good sharpener.
customer_reviews.text: This thing is incredible. I have about 4 of the cheezy hand held sharpeners that you slide your knife thru. All those do is make the blade very uneven. My daily use pocket knife was all sorts of screwed up because of it. I took this bad boy outta the package, plugged it in and within 30 seconds my knife had perfect edges and was sharp as hell. I'm sure you could get a better blade with a whetstone, but I don't have the time nor patience to mess with those. If you're serious about knives and tired of messing with all the other garbage, just get this and call it a day. Well worth it!!!

customer_reviews.title: Exceptional knife sharpner
customer_reviews.text: In my 25 years of cooking, I have never had a better knife sharpener than this tool. Very practical and effective and takes few minutes to sharpen the knifes back to new. Every month I sharpen about 15 knifes and it takes me less than 10 mins. I have had 10 different tools in the past and nothing compares the speed, quality, design and practicality of this tool.

customer_reviews.author: Chief

customer_reviews.text: Great sharpener will get your knife razor sharp in minutes you can literally shave hair on your arms after you run your knife through this thing it’s really great I’ve thrown away all my stones and rods and stuff they’re useless when I have this thing. customer_reviews.text: This sharpener works! customer_reviews.text: Nothing worse than using a dull kitchen knife. customer_reviews.author: ChicagoRandy

customer_reviews.title: Poor results and too cumbersome for kitchen knives
customer_reviews.text: This thing left a mess after sharpening and the changing of the belt and attachment is cumbersome. I definitely see its value for sharpening tools and other types of blades but not for kitchen knives, which is my use case. As such, I returned this and settled on.
customer_reviews.author: Nusaram

customer_reviews.title: Rather Long Learning Curve
customer_reviews.text: With some practice, I was able to get good results. But before I started getting really good, sharp edges, I honestly spent a lot of time trying to figure out how to get the best results even though I watched the videos several times. As of right now, I've probably put five solid hours of work with the machine and it's doing ok. But I've also found out that the sandpaper belts don't really last all that long.
customer_reviews.author: WoodenYouKnowIt

customer_reviews.title: It works amazingly well.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because the manual knife sharpeners weren't getting the knives as sharp, nor were they sharpening out the knicks in the blade. I saw this had over 7k reviews and it's electric. OMG! It works. It works so well I got carried away sharpening my knives. I started looking for scissors to sharpen. I love this product. It works very well. I even bought the case in order to protect and store it properly. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: Philo-sophia

customer_reviews.title: Probably OK if you're not too picky.
customer_reviews.text: Can't say it doesn't work but I can say it doesn't work like a stone. I don't like the tediousness of Arkansas stones so this seemed like a reasonable option. I have been searching for the easiest and effective sharpening system for years. But I just couldn't get my knives really sharp with this. I wanted it to work and I had high hopes, but it just doesn't go the distance. Also, though this didn't turn me off completely, it has the feel of a toy more than a tool with it's all plastic construction. I bought a 1x 30 belt sander for less and have had more success with it.
customer_reviews.author: Marty

customer_reviews.title: 10 out of 10
customer_reviews.text: I was hesitant to buy this and put it off for so long. I wish I hadn't. After the first time I sharpened my knife I knew I could never go back to wet stones or pull through sharpeners. It's quick easy and puts on a better edge than anything else. Highly recommended, 10 out of 10 would recommend and buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Havok

customer_reviews.title: Works beyond expectations!
customer_reviews.text: My only dislike of the Work Sharp device is that I am left handed which forced me to teach myself how to do the sharpening right handed To get the best results. I am reasonably ambidextrous and after Switching hands and becoming comfortable with the technique, I have sharpened several knives with some very impressive results. So simple a lefty can do it! Great tool! Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey Yeager

customer_reviews.title: Just do it!!
customer_reviews.text: I was a Lansky guy but found that it was sooooo time consuming to sharpen knives using that kit. Once you get your process down on this bad boy you will wonder why you waited to purchase it. I practiced on a few older knives and man did they clean up really nice. I've never had knives this sharp. Love the fact that I can hit my knives quickly and they are razor sharp. Changing bands to hone your edge is easy as well. Have not used it to sharpen any tools but the process seems simple enough.
customer_reviews.author: David Holliman

customer_reviews.title: Save your money
customer_reviews.text: I bought this in the hope it would help keep the existing edge on my knife. Total trash!. Im glad I tried to sharpen some of my other knifes instead of grinding away on my good knife. Total waste of money. Does not work as described. Im stuck with it and not sure I will ever use it on anything.
customer_reviews.author: DennisDillon

customer_reviews.title: LOVE it, but buying some intermediate belts between 220 and 6000
customer_reviews.text: UPDATE: 1.5 years later I still LOVE it. Best $70 you can spend for sharpening knives. Where was this thing all my life?! ORIGINAL REVIEW: Received my Work Sharp today and I've already sharpened most of the knives in the house. LOVE this sharpener! My only cautionary comment to other buyers concerns the Medium 220 grit belt. It's quite aggressive on softer steels, but perfect with harder ones. I'm going to order some 320 grit and 800 grit belts from an aftermarket manufacturer (Red Label Abrasives) and will try these to avoid removing too much metal, especially when sharpening softer steels, and for any knife that's not "butter knife dull". Definitely recommend the Work Sharp!
customer_reviews.author: Gambler

customer_reviews.title: Great sharpener once you get the hang of it
customer_reviews.text: I actually bought this because I couldn't find my old school knife sharpening kit. Was going to buy another kit with stones, but ran into the work sharpener with great reviews. I quickly reviewed the directions and tried to sharpen my Leatherman TTI. Although better, the results were not as good as I had hoped. Watched a few videos on it, tired again and came away with a blade as sharp as a razor. Truely amazed at results and how quickly it sharpens knives once you get the hang of it.
customer_reviews.author: dachshundlady

customer_reviews.title: Good up to a point
customer_reviews.text: This sharpener works really well to get a very dull knife to a certain level of sharpness but you'll probably still want to use a stone and leather strop to get that really fine, razor-sharp edge. So for knives that are too dull for a stone without spending a couple of hours on it, this will get that blade to the point where just a little bit of work with a stone and leather strop will be just what you need to get your knife to that top level of sharpness.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Kinkade

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: I read some of the negative reviews but still decided to take a chance and purchase this sharpener. The unit cane with belts and covers, as advertised. It is effortless to use and sharpens all my knives very well. I've been using it for quite a while now.
customer_reviews.author: EA

customer_reviews.title: One of the most useful tools yet
customer_reviews.text: I ***LOVE*** this tool. I can sharpen my riding mower blades without removing the mower deck; thus a 1/2 day job is now 10 minute. I also sharpened all the scissors (60 sec each), serrated knifes (30 sec), veggie peeler (2 min: I had to free-hand), and my camping knife (30 sec). The best money ever spent!!! Not good for left-handers though. If the belt can be run in reverse, or the belt pulley attachable to the other side of the motor, that would solve the issue.
customer_reviews.author: H.V.L.

customer_reviews.title: Great value when onsale
customer_reviews.text: I have been wanting one of these for a while and when Amazon offered it as a lightning deal I hoped right on it. I have used this version and the Ken onion version, the Ken onion is a lot nicer and does more but also costs a lot more. For just sharpening knives this thing is great. I highly recommend reading the manual and watching YouTube videos on how to use this correctly because if you don't you can break the sanding belts. Great addition to my kitchen.
customer_reviews.author: Nick Childs

customer_reviews.title: Super easy to use. Game changer!
customer_reviews.text: My whole life I have pretty much used “dull” knives. I would try and sharpen them with a stone, and they would get sharper than they were, but not SHARP. After 15 minutes with this thing, 8 kitchen knives are as sharp as when I bought them. Super easy to use and now I’m sharpening my friends’ knives.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Brown

customer_reviews.title: It's a fun little machine...
customer_reviews.text: This will get your blades very sharp. I don't have much hair left on my left forearm from testing all the kitchen knives and some of my folders. I would not recommend this for high end knives or tanto blades unless you are extremely patient and get a lot of practice. There's no way I'd run my Spyderco PM2 through this but it's perfect for kitchen knives you have laying in the drawer and your older knives. It's way too easy to round off the tip if you're not careful. If you do buy it be sure to get the leather strop belt too it takes your edge to the next level.
customer_reviews.author: BulletWithYourName

customer_reviews.title: Forget the stone
customer_reviews.text: Good construction, easy to use, great results. I'm a knife nut. They have to be sharp. I've got Henkles in the kitchen, and a variety of Kershaw EDC's. I thought I had the Henkles sharp. Nope. I did one knife that needed sharpening, and omg .., surgical sharp. In fact, after washing the knife, I bumped it with my hand. Not a slash across the blade, just a soft bump. It cut me pretty good. The Kershaw Brawler ... not a great knife but I like the tanto style. It dulled rather easily. The Thermite is my favorite. But, again, after using this sharpener ... razor sharp. Add the leather belt with compound and you'll never use a stone again.
customer_reviews.author: James R. Wheelock

customer_reviews.title: Excellent and recommended BUT
customer_reviews.text: It looks good, first trying give good results but the things that disappoint me is that the built positioning knob looks to be not working well also I noticed that there is no battery as described in the product specification in addition to no socket for 12 V as described in Stander pack one. Unfortunately I will not be able to return as I forwarded to my home county & will cost me more than its price to return.
customer_reviews.author: Mamdouh Tourab

customer_reviews.title: Big help
customer_reviews.text: I have never been able to sharpen my knives well. I could get by but almost never could I get one to shave. A friend showed me one of these in use and I decided right then to get one. I have sharpened almost every knife I own and most of them will shave. It's amazing how quick it is. There is a learning curve. It helps to watch the YouTube videos. I highly recommend this machine especially if you're like me.
customer_reviews.author: Harvey L Carter Jr

customer_reviews.title: Within seconds of receiving, 5 knives sharpened
customer_reviews.text: This is ABSOLUTELY AWESOME! Worth the price vs all the other 'so-called' sharpeners I bought in the past. From static pull-throughs, blocks, honing steels, etc. I'm the type that would sharpen knives once-a-month. I firmly believe in using the right tools for the job and to make sure that such tools are in full functioning status. I sharpened my 14-year old knives - Wu_ _ H_ _. Question is, how long will the sharpening belts last?
customer_reviews.author: rhcat

customer_reviews.title: Best sharpener I've ever used
customer_reviews.text: This device is easy to use and will get your knives as sharp as you want them. You just have to be careful when you come to the knife point. It is easy to round off the point if you draw the knife all the way through. You have to stop when the tip is almost halfway. I've also used it to sharpen axes, hoes machetes and other garden tools. the fine belt does seem to wear out fairly fast, but you can get a set of five or six fine belt replacements at Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Pitt

customer_reviews.title: Types of Belts / Cost of Belts
customer_reviews.text: It takes a little practice to get it right. The videos on their web-site were very helpful. They should be viewed BEFORE trying to use the sharpener. Also, remember "SAFEY FIRST'. Wear the appropriate safety gear when using. Had I known of the variety of belts available, I would have have ordered some of them. It should ship with some belts between the coarse belts and the super fine 6000 grit polishing belts. My only gripe is the cost of a box of 10 belts. Maybe they could cut the price some by changing the packing.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas on the edge (of America)

customer_reviews.title: Loves to wear out the sharpening belts
customer_reviews.text: The sharpener is OK, but not worth the cost because of the small abrasive belts it uses to sharpen a blade. The little sharpener itself is easy to use and does sharpen knife blades fairly sharp (but not razor sharp). The little belts it uses are way too thin and wear out before a good hard steel blade becomes sharp. You can buy replacement belts, but in my humble opinion, a good sharpening stone does a better job, just takes a little more elbow grease.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: I'm somewhat of a purist, in that I prefer to sharpen my knives with a whetrock and leather strop but when I'm feeling lazy, I use this thing and wow, it works really well and effective on different types of steel. One word of warning though, if you have a drop-point or curved knife, carefully follow the directions on how to sharpen those. Otherwise, you can mess up the tip of the knife by grinding it away.
customer_reviews.author: Hntr4339

customer_reviews.title: Works fine
customer_reviews.text: Not hard to use ai all. Getting extra belts is a good idea. I have tried this a number of times now and was very happy with how it works. It worked just fine on large and small knives to put a proper angle on the blade before the final hand sharping. You do have to be careful about the tip of the knife because it will round off the point if pulled completely through. Not a big problem just technigue. Worked well on real hard knife blades also getting them sharp was always a problem. It also has several used as a small belt sander for small hand detail jobs and too tuch up. I would recommend this tool.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Work Sharp - EASY TO USE
customer_reviews.text: Received in the mail and had all of my hunting knives sharped the same day. It is very easy to use and very pleased with the product. Amazon had the best price on the Work Sharp and shipping was fast as well. I also sharpened our kitchen knives the same afternoon. I have used both manual sharpeners and other electric sharpeners and none even come close to the Work Sharp sharpener. Very pleased with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: fxdwg

customer_reviews.title: Wow. I now have some seriously sharp knives.
customer_reviews.text: If you want sharp knives stop messing around with that little hand held thing in your kitchen drawer. Buy this thing and be ready to be in slicing heaven! I'm so glad my wife got this for me... best birthday present ever. My knives slice through everything with ease... and I thought they were pretty sharp before, nope... not compared to after sharpening them with this.
customer_reviews.author: M

customer_reviews.title: Razor Sharp Knives
customer_reviews.text: This is a great tool but there is a learning curve, use an old knife for practice before you move on to your expensive knives. It's easy once you get the hang of it, if you don't follow directions you could round off the knife point, practice a little. Replacing the belts can be annoying would be nice if they had a double belt one for sharpening and one for honing.
customer_reviews.author: Eli

customer_reviews.title: Wow - Simple to use and produces super sharp blades in minutes!
customer_reviews.text: I was about to ship my kitchen knives out for sharpening, mainly because I didn't have a lot of time to do myself. As a woodworker, I have a ton of sharpening equipment, but this tool exceeded my expectations. I was able to sharpen 7 kitchen knives in about 25 minutes using the 2 grits. The edges came out beautiful and scary sharp with a minimum of effort. Very low learning curve, but you should read the directions!
customer_reviews.author: Tbakes

customer_reviews.title: Sharp enough to shave!
customer_reviews.text: I love this product! I've tried sharpening rods, stones, ceramic sharpeners and they all SUCK! Takes too much time with stones and you'd have to be nuts to work on sharpening a knife for 10+ minutes. I just want something simple and effective. The Work Sharp is super easy to use and I was able to sharpen knives I might have thrown away due to dull edges. I also sharpened a old hatchet to a factory like edge. I highly recommend this product and recommend using your wet stones for paper weights!
customer_reviews.author: Christy & Tyler Barwick

customer_reviews.title: Excellent sharpner
customer_reviews.text: I bought this sharpener due to my neighbors recomandation. It worked Very well. I sharpened about 30 knives so far, about 12 swords , few battle axes & 2 pole arms & 1 halberd. Very good product. Easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Sina

customer_reviews.title: Best sharpener. Easy for females
customer_reviews.text: This is the best knife sharpener I’ve ever used. I have had sharpening stones and I just cannot get my knives sharp enough with them. This allows you to sharpen the blade at the perfect angle and my knives came out very sharp. I used to take them to a knife sharpening shop. But, that cost a lot of money. This device will provide return on investment with one use. I am very pleased with it. And I am female and able to use the device myself and change the bands and everything. I love to cook, and I was becoming so frustrated with cooking because it’s horrible to cook with dull blades. This has made me so happy.
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl Regan

customer_reviews.title: Work Sharp knife and tool sharpener
customer_reviews.text: This sharpener has saved my knives! I’ve tried sharpening with a stone, but I do not have the skill or patience to get the correct angle. With the Work Sharp, it has 2guides: one 25 degree angle for camp/tactical/every day carry knives and a second 20 degree angle for kitchen/ chef knives. With the three different bands, you can revitalize a worn knife and make it razor sharp. No hype, this thing is great. I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: LHowell

customer_reviews.title: sharpens knives in seconds, not minutes.
customer_reviews.text: i don't get a razor edge with this, but i get a workable blade in seconds. i love this thing. i gave one to my brother for christmas. when i got it, i sharpened every blade in the house, including garbage flea market blades i bought in the 90s. i tried it on a pair of scissors, and unfortunately the angle provided didn't match the angle of the blade, so i really had to grind the hell out of it. still, if you either aren't skilled in the art of sharpening or don't have the time, this baby will give you an edge on every blade you own, in SECONDS.
customer_reviews.author: lachrymal

customer_reviews.title: Quality an issue for me
customer_reviews.text: When I received the sharpener the power cord was frayed and I returned it. I have used this sharpener (my daughter in law) and it works very well with little effort on my part. I may reorder one at a later date.
customer_reviews.author: Richard A. Harrison

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: I purchase two Work Sharp Knife sharpeners. One for the cabin and the other for home. I use only two belts and once the knives are first sharpened, I use only the fine purple belt to dress up. Just takes a few seconds My knives are sharp.
customer_reviews.author: Eugene Kasper

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: I've never been good at using a sharpening stone, and came across this product as I was looking for a better way. Looked at some videos and read the reviews. I like this sharpener a lot. Take a really dull knife, and in a minute or two, it will be sharp enough to easily pass the slice through a sheet of paper test. Highly recommend this sharpener.
customer_reviews.author: Donna Bylenga

customer_reviews.title: Great All Around Sharpner!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is my first electric belt sharpener. So, I started with some old knives that I didn't care if they got jacked up. There is a learning curve if this is your first electric belt sharpener. After a few knives and YouTube videos, I got better at it. I have sharpened a half dozen knives and scissors, successfully. Overall, I think it is a very efficient, durable sharpener!
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: It arrived and I love it
customer_reviews.text: I just purchased one of these . After owning several stones and then a Lanksys system I became bored spending time with the whole mess. I did some research and then came across Doug Holser u tube vids on how to properly use this sharpener and was sold. Looking at all of the positive feedbacks and the price, I have to try it. All of the pros use belt systems to sharpen their knives. This unit looks perfect for a household . I will update this feedback when it arrives. It arrived and I love it. All of my kitchen knives are sharp. A little more practice and my good knives are next. .
customer_reviews.author: C. B.

customer_reviews.title: Amazing sharpener!!
customer_reviews.text: Wow this thing works great and saves a TON of time. I've used a lansky for years and sharpening used to be a chore. I almost returned it because it made my pocket knife TOO SHARP, feels like I'm carrying around a running chainsaw. Easy to change the belts, the guard and easy to change the angle of the belt to suit different tools. 1 knife = sharp in 2 minutes flat.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Dammitt

customer_reviews.title: Great Knife/Tool Sharpener
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to sharpen all the knives in my collection. It worked like a charm. My knives are razor sharp now. I used it on my kitchen knives as well. The machine is small and easy to use. I take it to work and sharped my axes as well. This is a great sharpening system! It would also make a great gift for men and women alike!
customer_reviews.author: Cody

customer_reviews.title: Versatile sharpener, kitchen to lawn mower
customer_reviews.text: This is a unique traveling band type sharpener that I have used on an axe, kitchen knives, and a rotary mower blade. I used different grit size bands in each case from the assortment provided, but also bought a replacement set. Two things missing - the scale may be a surprise, pictures make it look bigger, and no storage case other than the box.
customer_reviews.author: LandPyro

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Sharpener
customer_reviews.text: This is not a tool you want to use on your best kitchen knives, which you should sharpen with a stone. However, I’ve sharpened other kitchen knives, scissors, sheers, an axe, lawn mower blade, and a machete, and it worked VERY well. It’s easy to use and adjustable for almost any shape of blade.
customer_reviews.author: MarkB

customer_reviews.title: Only way i sharpen my knifes
customer_reviews.text: quickly gives a very sharp knife and doesn't round the tip IF and only if you stop the belt with the knife still on the belt like the instructions say. It may not get the knife sharp enough for all you "edge snobs" out there. But for the average consumer, itll be more than sharp enough. No problem shaving with the edge this sharpener can put on a knife.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Sharpens quickly and efficiently
customer_reviews.text: I have had this for over a year now. It works great, just as advertised. I haven't had an issue with it yet, just buy some extra belts for it. The learning curve is pretty simple, still, I would start on something small and used. If you push the top of the blade over too far you can run it into the belt and scratch the blade. If it is really dull it may take a few passes to start the process. Easy to use, portable and effective.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Terrific sharpener
customer_reviews.text: This product was purchased as a gift for my parents as all their kitchen knives we're in serious need of attention. With little time and very little effort all knives are as sharp as a razor. Unlike other knife sharpeners, the belt used to hone with this sharpener removes nicks and gouges from the blades. Very nice sharpener however it is difficult to hone knives with a hawkbill blade.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Underwood

customer_reviews.title: Missing Parts
customer_reviews.text: My unit arrived with only the kitchen knife guide. Sharpened up a few knives, did a great job, but for the price I paid I would like all of the parts I paid for. Looking at other reviews this seems to be common for parts to be missing. Guess I'll box it up and send it back. It's too bad as I think this could be a great sharpener to have around.
customer_reviews.author: DudeFromMinot

customer_reviews.title: Easy and sharp!
customer_reviews.text: Ive been wanting this fir awhile and my girlfriend got it for me for my birthday it works great i just spent about 3 hours sharpening my pocket knives kitchen knives and my camping knives/ machetes it worked awesome my s30v kershaw blur "very hard steel to sharpen" was cutting hair in less than 5 mins!!! its easy to use i do recommend watching a couple videos on how to use so ya dont get a blunt tip "first knife i tried i gave it a blunt tip on accident" but once i watched a video on it it shows what i did wrong and continued to sharpen all the knives in the house
customer_reviews.author: Dakota B.

customer_reviews.title: Nice product, but...
customer_reviews.text: Husband requested this, and used it right away....once. product_meta.description: Style:Sharpener| Product Packaging:Standard PackagingOther Info: Replaceable abrasive grit belts. Won't burn or damage blade steel. Precision sharpening guides for kitchen, pocket, hunting, and serrated knives. 6 foot power cord. Three belts (P80-coarse, P220-Medium, and 6000-Fine). Instructional guide and DVD. Boxed.
feature_bullets: Sharpen every knife you own like a pro quickly, easily and with repeatable, consistent results. Creates the sharpest blades you've ever had!

Easily Replaceable Abrasive Grit Belts. Comes with premium abrasive belts to meet all your sharpening needs: Coarse (P80), Medium (P220) and Fine (6000). Abrasive belts won't burn or damage blade steel during sharpening.
Precision sharpening guides provide fast, easy, repeatable and consistent results. Kitchen Knife guide sharpens blades to a 40° angle – Outdoor Knife Guide sharpens to a 50° angle.

Can also be used to sharpen a wide range of bladed shop tools and lawn and garden tools such as Lawn Mower Blades, Garden Pruners, Shears, Shovels, Scrapers and more. Also makes the ideal hand held detail grinder
